00059 struct PIDSetItem {
00060     /* data */
00061     struct pid * _pidpointer;
00062     pid_t _pid_no;
00063 
00064     typedef struct pid * key_type;
00065     typedef struct pid * key_const_reference;
00066 
00067     key_const_reference hashkey() const {
00068         return _pidpointer;
00069     }
00070 
00071     /*constructor*/
00072     PIDSetItem(struct pid * _pidp) : _pidpointer(_pidp) {
00073     }
00074 };
00077 typedef HashTable<PIDSetItem> PIDSet;
00080 typedef PIDSet::iterator PIDSetIter;
00081 #endif

00087 class Netlink : public Element {
00088 public:
00093     Netlink();
00098     ~Netlink();
00103     const char *class_name() const {return "Netlink";}
00108     const char *port_count() const {return "0/0";}
00113     const char *processing() const {return AGNOSTIC;}
00118     int configure_phase() const {
00119         return 300;
00120     }
00130     int initialize(ErrorHandler *errh);
00136     void cleanup(CleanupStage stage);
00137     /*members*/
00138 #if CLICK_LINUXMODULE
00139 
00141     struct sock *nl_sk;
00142 #else
00143 
00145     int fd;
00146 #if !HAVE_USE_NETLINK
00147     struct sockaddr_un s_nladdr;
00148 #endif
00149 
00151     std::queue <WritablePacket *> out_buf_queue;
00152 #endif
00153 };

00168 #if !HAVE_USE_NETLINK
00169 #define ba_id2path(path, id)  \
00170     snprintf((path), 100, "/tmp/blackadder.%05u", (id))
00171 #if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__OpenBSD__)
00172 inline int
00173 ba_path2id(const char *path)
00174 {
00175     const char *errstr = NULL;
00176     int num = (int)strtonum((path) + 16, 0, 99999/*PID_MAX*/, &errstr);
00177     return (errstr == NULL) ? num : -1;
00178 }
00179 #else
00180 #define ba_path2id(path) atoi((path) + 16)
00181 #endif
00182 #endif
00183 #endif
